resources.string: Reading iCal file, can take a few minutes.
Please enter an URL of an iCal file below which starts with http:// or ftp://
Do you really want to delete the entries?
Do you want to search for duplicates, will take longer?"

No calendars found.

You must create a calendar to import to/export from. You can install "Offline Calendar" to create one.

If you are using Cyanogenmod: Make sure that Privacy Guard is disabled for this application to allow calendar read/write.

If you are using Android 4.3 App Ops: Make sure that you allow calendar read/write access for this application.
iCal file could not be parsed\n\n
I am sorry for you inconvinience. Please open a new issue report on http://sufficientlysecure.org/android-apps and attach ical_error.log located on your sd card.

Version 1.6:
New forked version
Many fixes for Android >= 4.0
New design 

Version 1.5:
Basic Http authentication and Ftp authentication via input fields. Small bugfix regarding dummy calendar. Insert manual alarm, no VAlarm support. 

Version 1.4:
Released under GPL v3, source available under: http://code.google.com/p/ical-import-export/ 
A life without google: If you have no calendars installed, a local calendar can be created. But there has to be an existing account (yahoo, or something else) 

Version 1.3:
Saves the last URL 

Version 1.2:
Timezone of an event will be changed according to your local android timezone. I am not sure if that works, timezones are very confusing. 

Version 1.1:
Associate program with iCal files. Working in web browser. In Froyo also working with any type of file browser. 

Version 1.0:
Supporting simple iCal import and export. Attendees are not supported.
